definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The half-hour of footage is funny and thrilling.
sentences.chinese: 半小時的片花相當有趣，讓人興奮不已。

sentences.english: How do movie theaters decide which trailers to show?
sentences.chinese: 那影院是怎麼決定播放什麼片花的呢？

sentences.english: Teenage girls started lining up on the street to see snippets from the second movie in the series.
sentences.chinese: 女孩子們在街上排着長隊看第二集中的片花。

definition: opening titles (of movie)/leader (blank film at the beginning and end of a reel)
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
photo taken during a theatrical production/a still (from a movie)
cast (of a movie etc)/lineup of performers/troupe
(of an actor) to disengage from the performance (e.g. after the show ends)/(of an audience) to lose interest in the performance
to broadcast/to air (a TV program etc)
idol drama/drama series in which the actors are chosen for their preexisting popularity with young viewers
